shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Dawit “Psalter” (fols. 4r-171vb) I-1) Mäzmurä Dawit “Psalms of David” (fols. 4r-139v) I-2) Mäḫalǝyä näbiyat “The Canticles of the Prophets” (fols. 139v-153v) I-3) Mäḫalǝyä mäḫalǝy “Song of Songs” (fols. 154r-162r) I-4) Wǝddase Maryam “The Praise of Mary” (fols. 162ra-169ra) I-5) ʾAnqäṣä bǝrhan “The Gate of Light” (fols. 169ra-171vb)
Colophon.

copyists.copyist: Wäldä Tǝnśaʾe is mentioned as the scribe in the colophon.

donors.donor: Wäldä ʾIyäsus is mentioned as the commissioner in the colophon.

dcomments.dcomment: According to the colophon, the Ms. was completed on Gǝnbot 17, 1896 year of mercy (= May 25, 1904 A.D.).

txstates.txstate: The spine cover is damaged. The sewing is damaged and crudely repaired with a cotton thread. Part of the tailband is missing.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather; textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover (at least 7 tools were used: double line fillet, double circle, corni form, small x, cross hatching, interlaced dot fillet, fourfold line fillet).

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible in the centre fold of some quires, one close to the head and one close to the tail of the codex.

squires.squire: A(3; s.l.: 2, stub after 1/fols. 1r-3v) – I(10/fols. 4r-13v) – II(10/fols. 14r-23v) – III(10/fols. 14r-23v) – IV(10/fols. 34r-43v) – V(10/fols. 44r-53v) – VI(10/fols. 54r-63v) – VII(10/fols. 64r-73v) – VIII(10/fols. 74r-83v) – IX(10/fols. 84r-93v) – X(10/fols. 94r-103v) – XI(10/fols. 104r-113v) – XII(10/fols. 114r-123v) – XIII(10/fols. 124r-133v) – XIV(10/fols. 134r-143v) – XV(10/fols. 144r-153v) – XVI(10/fols. 154r-163v) – XVII(10/fols. 164r-173v).

taunit.mr-info: Texts I-1, I-2, I-3: all data for fol 6r.
taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible (s. fol. 168r). Ruling pricks are visible (s. fol. 106r). The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

taunit.mr-info: Texts I-4, I-5: all data for fol. 169r.
taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rubrications.rubrication:
Nomina sacra (name of God in Texts I-1; name of St. Mary in Texts I-4, I-5); name of the scribe; titles and numbers of the Pss., Canticles and Songs; title of Texts I-2, I-3, I-4, I-5; title and incipit of the daily readings of Text I-4; name and traditional interpretation of the Hebrew letters in Ps. 118; letters ባ and ክ of the word ይባርክዎ in Canticle 10; initial letters of some words in Texts I-4 and I-5; elements of the punctuation signs.
A few lines (alternating with black lines) on the incipit page of Texts I-1; two lines (alternating with a black line) of the incipit of each Ps., Canticle and Song.

abbreviations.abbreviation: እ᎓ for እስመ᎓ ለዓለም᎓ ምሕረቱ᎓ (Ps. 135, fol. 128r-v) ስ᎓ for ስቡሕኒ᎓ ውእቱ᎓ ወልዑልኒ᎓ ውእቱ᎓ ለዓለም᎓ (Canticle 10, fols. 149r-150r) Text I-4 ሰ፡ ለ፡ ቅ፡ for ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት፡ Words or their abbreviations stand for the whole refrain: ሠ፡ for ሠረቀ፡ በሥጋ፡ እምድንግል፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ዘርአ፡ ብእሲ፡ ወአድኅነነ (fol. 162rb-vb) እ፡/እስ፡ for እስመ፡ በፈቃዱ፡ ወበሥምረቱ፡ አቡሁ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ መጽአ፡ ወአድኅነነ (fols. 163ra-164ra) ኵ፡ for ኵሉ፡ ትውልድ፡ ያስተበፅዑኪ፡ ለኪ፡ ለበሕቲትኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ (fols. 164rb-vb) ና፡ for ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ። እስመ፡ ሣህልኪ፡ ይኵን፡ ላዕለ፡ ኵልነ (fols. 165rb-166rb) ለኪ፡ for ለኪ፡ ለበሕቲትኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ እመ፡ ብርሃን፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ በስብሐት፡ ወበውዳሴ (fol. 166vab) ተ፡/ተፈ፡ for ተፈሥሒ፡ ኦምልዕልተ፡ ጸጋ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እስመ፡ ረከብኪ፡ ሞገስ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ምስሌኪ (fols. 167va-168ra) ወ፡/ወበ፡ for ወበእንተዝ፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ንጽሕት፡ ኵሎ፡ ጊዜ፡ ንስእል፡ ወናንቀዓዱ፡ ከመ፡ ንርከብ፡ ሣህለ፡ በኀበ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሰብእ (fols. 169v) Text I-5 ወ፡ ሣ፡ ይ፡ ሰ፡ ቅ፡ for ወልድኪ፡ ሣህሎ፡ ይክፍለነ፡ ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት በእን፡ for በእንተ፡ (fols. 169rb-171va)

colophon.tran: Fol. 172r: This book was written in the reign of Mənilək II, in the 1896 year of mercy, in the year of (the Evangelist) John, on Gənbot 17, on Wednesday, in the ninth hour (of the day). May He have mercy, in the Kingdom of Heaven, both on its scribe, the sinner and wrongdoer Wäldä Tənśaˀe, and on its commissioner Wäldä ˀIyäsus (n. l.).
colophon.det: The name of the scribe, Wäldä Tǝnśaʾe, and of the commissioner, Wäldä ʾIyäsus, have been partially erased.

extras.extra: - The title of the Ms., ዳዊት, is written on the front board, in black. The back board bears the same inscription on a piece of white paper glued onto it. - The Pss. are divided into groups of ten separated by an ornamental band. - The scribe reduced the size of his handwriting to accommodate the whole line or the end of the line: e.g., fols. 4r, 9r, 17v, 19r, 26r, 59r, 61v, 75r, 122r, 140r, 144r, 150r. - Part of the line is taken up: e.g., fols. 4r. 5rv, 6r, 17v, 26v, 28r, 52r, 111v, 122r. - Writing exercises, scribbles, doodles: fols. 1rv, 3rv, 172r, 173rv.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Red threads inserted in the right upper corner of fols. 11, 39.

miniature.info: Fol. 2v: St. George slaying the dragon.

frames.frame: Fol. 4r (incipit page of Text I-1): coloured (orange, red, blue, black outline) ornamental band with floral motifs extending to the top of the fol.; interlaces, floral motifs.
